alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:16PM CST until February 19 at 11:10AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... St. Francis River near Patterson. .The St. Francis River near Patterson has crested just below moderate flood stage. Water levels will continue to drop...with the river now forecast to fall below flood stage late tonight or Saturday morning. For the St. Francis River...including Patterson, Fisk...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Francis River near Patterson. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 8.4 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
